p: This novel virus, SARS-CoV-2, comes under the subgenus Sarbecovirus of the Orthocoronavirinae subfamily and is entirely different from the viruses responsible for MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV ( 3). The newly emerged SARS-CoV-2 is a group 2B coronavirus ( 2). The genome sequences of SARS-CoV-2 obtained from patients share 79.5% sequence similarity to the sequence of SARS-CoV ( 63).
